snippet: Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif said American officials must do more to assure other countries that they could do business in Iran without risking penalties.
abstract: Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif says in interview with The New York Times editorial board that country does not want access to American financial system as part of nuclear deal; calls on United States to actively assure countries and companies that they can do business with Iran without incurring penalties from US.
lead_paragraph: Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif said American officials must do more to assure other countries that they could do business in Iran without risking penalties.

headline.main: Iran Not Seeking Entry to U.S. Financial System, Envoy Says
headline.print_headline: Iran Denies  Seeking Entry  to Banking  in the U.S.
